Appearance
From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: buddhist

English

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • Bouddhist (obsolete)
  • Boodhist (archaic)

Etymology

[edit]

From Buddha +‎ -ist.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈbudɪst/, /ˈbʊdɪst/
  • Audio (UK):(file)
  • Rhymes: -uːdɪst, -ʊdɪst

Adjective

[edit]

Buddhist (comparative more Buddhist, superlative most Buddhist)

  1. Of, relating to, or practicing Buddhism.

Derived terms

[edit]
  • anti-Buddhist
  • Buddhist sabbath
  • Buddhist Sabbath
  • Tibetan Buddhist

Related terms

[edit]
  • buddha, Buddha
  • Buddhism

Translations

[edit]

  • Arabic: بُوذِيّ (ar) (būḏiyy)

of, relating to a Buddhist, Buddhists
  • Arabic: بُوذِيّ (ar) (būḏiyy)
  • Catalan: budista
  • Danish: buddhistisk
  • Esperanto: budhista
  • Finnish: buddhalainen (fi)
  • Galician: budista

  • Italian: buddista (it)
  • Malay: Buddha
  • Marathi: बौद्ध (bauddha)

    Bokmål: buddhistisk
    Nynorsk: buddhistisk

  • Spanish: budista (es)
  • Ukrainian: будди́стський (buddýstsʹkyj)
  • Vietnamese: Phật (vi), Phật tử
  • Volapük: budanik

Noun

[edit]

Buddhist (plural Buddhists)

  1. A practitioner of the religion and philosophy of Buddhism.
  2. A follower of the Indian religious and spiritual teacher, Buddha.

Hypernyms

[edit]
  • religionist

Derived terms

[edit]
  • Buddhistic

German

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /bʊˈdɪst/
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)

Noun

[edit]

Buddhist m (weak, genitive Buddhisten, plural Buddhisten, feminine Buddhistin)

  1. Buddhist (male or of unspecified gender)

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Buddhist [masculine, weak]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative ein der Buddhist die Buddhisten
genitive eines des Buddhisten der Buddhisten
dative einem dem Buddhisten den Buddhisten
accusative einen den Buddhisten die Buddhisten

Derived terms

[edit]
  • Buddhistentum
  • Buddhistin
  • buddhistisch

Related terms

[edit]
  • Buddhismus

[edit]
